text.__SUMMARY__: Grant's worm snake (Antillotyphlops granti) is a species of snake in the family Typhlopidae. The species is endemic to Puerto Rico.
text.Etymology: The specific name, granti, is in honor of American herpetologist Chapman Grant.
text.Geographic range: It is found in southwestern Puerto Rico, including Caja de Muertos, an island 8 miles (13 km) offshore from Ponce.
text.Further reading: Ruthven AG, Gaige HT (1935). "Observations on Typhlops from Puerto Rico and some of the adjacent islands". Occ. Pap. Mus. Zool. Univ. Michigan 307: 1-12. (Typhlops granti, new species, pp. 2-4, Figure 1).
